title: "Association and Exclusion Techniques for Memory Improvement"
first_phrase: In the previous section, the text discussed mnemonic techniques using visual associations. In the last 200 tokens, the focus shifts towards language-based mnemonic devices. The author introduces various concepts such as objects and their symbols, artistic works and their creators, and literary devices like similes, exclusion through antithesis, hostility, and incompatibility. The practical applications of these techniques are further explained in Volume 63 of Mnemotecnica, the natural complement to this text. The author also provides an example of how to use these techniques to remember a name, such as Bianchi, by creating various associations.

last_phrase: In conclusion, the application of word association can greatly enhance memory recall and aid in the classification of ideas. Creating mental frameworks or organizational charts can further streamline this process, allowing for efficient categorization and retention of information. Consider utilizing these techniques to improve your own memory and personal organization. For further explanation and practical application, refer to Mnemonic (Artificial Memory), vol.63.
